meanings.definition: moderation or self-restraint in action or statement
meanings.sent1: Her temperances in eating helped her stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: He showed great temperances in his spending habits.
meanings.sent3: His temperances in video game playing made him the slowest but most strategic player.
meanings.sent4: The temperances in her voice made her a calming presence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's temperances in grading ensured fairness for all students.

meanings.sent1: The temperances of the metal made it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The temperances of the recipe resulted in a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The temperances of the artist's brush strokes created a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The temperances of the negotiation led to a mutually beneficial agreement.
meanings.sent5: The temperances of the weather made for a pleasant afternoon.
